name: dasshboard
description: A stylish, theme-aware dashboard for quickly connecting to SSH hosts, WSL distros and Docker containers with customizable settings

commands.title: DaSSHboard: Check Extension and Connection Status

daSSHboard.openAtStartup.description: Automatically open the DaSSHboard when VS Code starts

daSSHboard.statusBarIcon.description: Lucide icon name for the status bar button icon

daSSHboard.sshSectionColor.description: Color for SSH section title, host count background, and host badge (CSS color). Leave empty to use theme default.

daSSHboard.wslSectionColor.description: Color for WSL section title, host count background, and host badge (CSS color). Leave empty to use theme default.

daSSHboard.dockerSectionColor.description: Color for Docker section title, host count background, and host badge (CSS color). Leave empty to use theme default.

daSSHboard.sshSectionCollapsed.description: Whether the SSH section is collapsed in the dashboard

daSSHboard.wslSectionCollapsed.description: Whether the WSL section is collapsed in the dashboard

daSSHboard.dockerSectionCollapsed.description: Whether the Docker section is collapsed in the dashboard

enumDescriptions: Display hosts in a grid layout
Display hosts in a list layout
daSSHboard.layout.description: Layout mode for the dashboard (grid or list view)

daSSHboard.hosts.description: Custom settings for SSH hosts and WSL distros

folders.description: List of folders to connect to on this host, distro, or container (defaults vary by type)

color.description: Custom color for this host's icon (CSS color). Leave empty for theme default.

icon.description: Custom icon for this host. Use 'lucide:icon-name' for Lucide icons or 'filename' for SVG files in media/hosts folder

scripts.vscode:prepublish: npm run compile && npm run copy-lucide
scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
